result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharquis K Rhodes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: If defendant is revoked, after 6 months straight time, the Court authorizes the remaining 6 months Huber for work and school, as well as the Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes: No contact with WalMart located at 401 W. Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA). All applicable fees of supervision. No Cash Bail Posted in this matter. Payment plan of $66/month. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution in the amount of $3,682.05 payable to WalMart FIRST PRIORITY.
Provide DNA sample. Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Upon successful completion of probation, including ALL restitution paid, Court will consider motion for expungement.

timeConds.notes: Straight time. STAYED for use at the agent's discretion.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to 1 YEAR in the House of Corrections with 3 days credit for time served.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  If defendant is revoked after 6 months STRAIGHT TIME the Court authorizes the remaining 6 months Huber for work and school, as well as the day reporting center.

Conditions of Probation:
- 60 days condition time STAYED for use at the agents discretion.  STRAIGH TIME.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: Walmart located at 401 W. Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $3,682.05 payable to Walmart- FIRST PRIORITY; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Payment plan of $66/month

Upon successful completion of probation, including ALL restitution paid, Court will consider motion for expungement.


Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Sharquis K Rhodes in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Lucy Kronforst for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Restitution Request Form received and filed.

Defendant Sharquis K Rhodes in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of James C Griffin.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, Plea and Sentencing is scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-27-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sharquis K Rhodes in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Nicholas Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of James C Griffin .
Plea Hearing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Plea and Sentencing scheduled for 07-29-2014 at 01:3pm in Branch 22.

Defendant Sharquis K Rhodes in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  
Plea Hearing scheduled for 06-20-2014 at 08:30am in Branch 22.  
James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin later in the morning telephonically , and received adjourned Plea Hearing Date at that time.

Defendant Sharquis K Rhodes in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-12-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Sharquis K Rhodes in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Sara Schroeder for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Yamahiro.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL WALMART STORES IN THE USA.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Sharquis K Rhodes in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Sharquis K Rhodes in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
